doc.title: J.P.Morgan
doc.source_uri: 2025-12-31/Bank of Ningbo - A 2Q25- Core earnings growth back on trackBank of Ningbo - A 2Q25- Core earnings growth back on track_2025-12-31

passages.text: 2Q25- Core earnings growth Back of track

2Q25 results - net positive. BoNB pre- announced its results in July (link), but the incremental information from the full report is net positive. On the positive side: 1) core earnings stayed strong, with 2Q NII (+11% y/y) and fee income (+10% y/y) beating JPMc by 1%/10% respectively; 2) forward- looking AQ indicators, including SML ratio, overdue ratio and NPL formation ratio all showed signs of improvement on a h/h basis in 1H25, while retail AQ remains under pressure; 3) capital positions improved marginally in 2Q, and the bank proposed an interim dividend for the first time (pending shareholder approval). On the negative side, 2Q NIM contraction of - 8bps q/q lagged industry trends. On a net basis, this is a solid set of results and we expect the market to react positively. Reiterate OW.

- Strong core earnings growth. 2Q25 NII +11% y/y, supported by strong loan growth of 2% q/q (or 19% y/y) and effective liability cost management. 2Q fee income growth of +10% y/y was a beat. Meanwhile, BoNB is committed to developing its WM business, with double-digit h/h growth in its 1H25 retail AUM and PB AUM (Table 6).

- Marginally improved capital position. In 2Q25, BoNB's CET1/Tier-1 /CAR were 9.65%/10.75%/15.21%, +33bps/31bps/28bps q/q respectively. The company has strengthened its internal capital generation ability and optimized the asset structure, with RWA density (RWA/Asset) falling by -7pcts q/q in 2Q. This should ease investors' concerns somewhat about its capital level.

- Forward-looking AQ metrics fine-tuned. 2Q25 NPL ratio remained flat q/q at 0.76% and NPL coverage ratio improved by 4pcts q/q to 374%. Moreover, we saw marginal improvement in its forward-looking AQ indicators. In 1H25, SML ratio fell by 1bps h/h and overdue loan ratio by 6bps h/h. We calculate the annualized 1H25 NPL formation ratio was 106bps, vs 134bps in 2H24. Despite the improved AQ outlook, retail AQ risks rose in 1H25. Personal consumption and personal business NPL ratio increased by 23bps/33bps h/h respectively.

- Interim dividend was a surprise. BoD proposed an interim dividend for the first time, which is pending approval from a shareholders' meeting. The proposed DPS is Rmb 0.3 per share, implying an interim dividend payout ratio of 14%. We expect the full-year payout ratio to remain stable (FY24: 23% cash payout ratio).

- 2Q25 NIM contracted 8bps q/q. This was more significant than the banking industry average of -3bps q/q, as disclosed by NAFR. On a semi-annual basis, IEA yield fell 32bps h/h in 1H25, mainly due to a 38bps fall in loan yield, while funding cost only fell 21bps h/h. The silver lining is time deposit migration â€“ time deposits as a % of total deposits fell from 66% in 2H24 to 62% in 1H25.

J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.

Table 6:Bank of Ningbo retail and PB AUM
Source:Bank of Ningbo 1H23-1H25 semi-annual and 2022, 2023, 2024 annual reports.

Bank of Ningbo differentiates itself from its small bank peers with its 1) wealth management development strategy; 2) focus on local SME and high- net- worth retail clients and 3) comprehensive service platforms that increase client stickiness. As a regional bank, BoNB is more flexible than larger banks to accommodate macro changes. At the same time, the bank enjoys greater economies of scale than its smaller bank peers.

BoNB's reasonable management incentive system ensures that its strategy can be effectively implemented, in our view. Meanwhile, the market- oriented mechanism suggests higher potential to expand market share and deliver growth in an upward market cycle.

We think BoNB can maintain better ROE than its peers, aided by its 1) attractive risk- adjusted asset yield and strong funding franchise; 2) prudent risk management, especially in the higher- risk sectors; 3) development of capital- light business, i.e. fee business; and 4) the strength of Ningbo's local economy.
Our Dec- 25 price target of Rmb32.0 is based on a dividend discount model, assuming a cost of capital of \(14.1\%\) , a normalized ROE of \(11.80\%\) and a terminal date of 31 December 2027.

Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months.
